response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and line two 8-inch round cake pans. Sift together 2 cups flour, 1¾ cups sugar, ¾ cup cocoa, 1½ tsp baking soda, and 1 tsp salt in a large bowl.",
  "step2": "Add 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 tsp vanilla to dry ingredients. Mix on medium speed until combined, about 2 minutes. Gradually add 1 cup boiling water, mixing until smooth (batter will be thin).",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.",
  "step4": "For frosting, beat 1 cup softened butter until creamy. Gradually add 3½ cups powdered sugar and 1 cup cocoa, alternating with ½ cup milk. Mix in 2 tsp vanilla until smooth and spreadable.",
  "step5": "Place one cake layer on serving plate. Spread with ⅓ of frosting. Top with second layer. Frost top and sides with remaining frosting, creating smooth or decorative swirls as desired.",
  "step6": "Optional: garnish with chocolate shavings or sprinkles. Let cake set for 30 minutes before slicing. Serve at room temperature. Store covered at room temperature for up to 3 days."
}
